alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 9:44PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast California and south central Nevada, including the following counties, in southeast California, southern Inyo, including Death Valley. In south central Nevada, southern Nye. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 944 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pahrump, Shoshone, Furnace Creek, Death Valley Junction, Texas Springs Campground, Tecopa and Panamint Springs. This includes portions of State Route 190 in California as well as Highway 160 in Nevada. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
